title: None of my links work on my Firefox browser, they keep "trying" to connect but never do (after days...)
content:
I use Pocket on my MacBook Air 2017 MACOS Monterey 12.7.6, and used it daily for years. I cannot access Pocket just now so cannot give you any data about its version. Below is a screenshot of the Firefox version that I just loaded yesterday but which is also refusing to load any link, incl. Pocket. No error message now; yesterday when Firefox refused to load anything, a message saying "Not Secure" showed up atop my screen left of the link I was attempting; it showed up for every link I tried, but is no longer showing up at all, though Firefox continues to be unable to load any link. Second screenshot below is my current attempt to load 2 links plus Pocket, a video of it would show all 3 loading attempts on the screenshot having the little dot moving back and forth side-to-side but never loading. Hope this helps! And thank you kindly for assisting me, Alasdair Coyne

Attachment(s) Screen Shot 2025-04-10 at 4.17.50 PM.png Screen Shot 2025-04-10 at 4.09.23 PM.png
creator: sespecoyne

title: Youtube Picture In Picture mode resets video location when scrolling down and logged into specific account
content:
Can't use YT picture in picture mode on Firefox when logged into my YT account. When I enable picture in picture on a video and scroll down to the comments, picture in picture mode turns off as soon as I scroll past the bottom of the video.

Happens only when I'm logged into my YT account on Firefox. Logout, it works. Logged in on Edge, it works. Logged into my second YT account on Firefox, it works. Only doesn't work for this one account.

Attached images if that helps. Last image shows exactly when picture in picture mode turns off when I'm scrolling
creator: lieu.kristella

title: Tab Crash - As of today, ALL addons are causing a crash
content:
As of today, when I launch firefox, all of my tabs (which have been working fine for the last several days) crash.

https://i.imgur.com/7vrmvam.png

By disabling all of my addons, I get this to go away - and by testing addons one at a time I am able to determine that: -Ublock Origin -Kaskpersky Password Manager Cause all of my tabs to crash.

Whereas: -Sponsorblock for Youtube -Youtube Nonstop Both crash if I visit youtube, but don't affect the browser otherwise.

So it seems like ALL addons are currently broken when they try to affect a tab?
creator: darkdobe
